cause_of_action: AstraZeneca challenged Health Canada's decision allowing Apotex to produce a generic version of LOSEC without addressing certain patents

cause_of_action: Transfer of aquaculture regulation from provincial to federal jurisdiction post-Morton decision led to concerns over consultation with KAFN.
relevant_rule: The Crown's duty to consult arises when it has knowledge of potential Aboriginal rights and contemplates conduct that might adversely affect them.
procedure_steps: KAFN sought judicial review claiming inadequate consultation. Court reviewed evidence of DFO's consultation efforts over 22 months.
decision_reasoning: DFO consulted extensively over 22 months post-Morton decision, developing regulations and engaging with First Nations. Despite limited time, DFO issued transitional one-year licenses while continuing consultations.
result_of_case: Court found DFO's consultation efforts reasonable and dismissed the application for judicial review.
